merged_caption: This video captures a wide scenery shot of a modern, empty subway station from a tilted perspective. Initially, the frame is oriented at an almost diagonal tilt, with the digital screen occupying the top left to center area, displaying the time as approximately 10:35, the track number "Gleis 1," and an "SOS Nothalt" (Emergency Stop) button. The escalator is visible in the left background, and the ceiling and tunnel wall are on the right. The camera moves backward quickly and smoothly while simultaneously rolling counterclockwise, creating a varying Dutch angle throughout the shot. This rotation adds a dynamic effect, showing the clean platform, train tracks, and blue-lit tunnel walls rushing by. As the camera rotates, the digital sign shifts from the foreground to the background, revealing more of the platform’s overall appearance. A series of large, curved overhead structures with rounded, hooded lights in shades of yellow, orange, and blue appear in the foreground and transition to the middle ground and background, projecting reflective colors onto the ground. By the end, the platform floor occupies the bottom center from foreground to background, while the ceiling, track bed, and tunnel wall occupy the right side of the frame from foreground to background. The entire subway station scene is captured in deep focus, keeping all elements sharp. The station appears clean and mostly empty, with its architectural features and lighting creating a distinct, contemporary atmosphere.

3. Motion: Describes the movement and dynamics of subjects
4. Spatial: Describes the spatial relationships and framing
5. Camera: Describes camera movements and framing choices

Input Captions:
{captions}

2. Merge MOTION and CAMERA captions into the spatial description to create a temporally coherent narrative that describes how things change over time
3. Add information from SUBJECT and SCENE captions ONLY if they contain unique details not already covered in the Spatial caption
4. Eliminate ALL redundant information - if the same detail appears in multiple captions, mention it only ONCE
5. Preserve the EXACT wording from the original captions - do NOT paraphrase
6. When describing temporal changes, integrate motion and camera movements in chronological order to show how the scene evolves
7. CRITICAL: Every unique detail from all five captions must appear in the final merged caption - nothing should be omitted
8. Do NOT add any information not present in the original captions
9. Return only the merged caption without any additional text or formatting

Goal: A single, temporally coherent caption based on the Spatial description, with Motion and Camera information merged chronologically, and Subject/Scene details added only when they provide new information. Keep as many details as possible but limit to at most 320 words.
